data.chText: 选举，推选（尤指从政）
data.enText: the process of choosing a person or a group of people for a position, especially a political position, by voting

data.chText: 竞选运动；选举结果
data.enText: election campaigns/results

data.chText: 在选举中获胜 / 失败
data.enText: to win/lose an election

data.chText: 参加竞选
data.enText: to fight an election

data.chText: 参加投票选举
data.enText: to vote in an election

data.chText: 美国每四年举行一次总统选举。
data.enText: In America, presidential elections are held every four years.

data.chText: 首相即将宣布举行大选。
data.enText: The prime minister is about to call (= announce) an election .

data.chText: 有多少候选人参加竞选？
data.enText: How many candidates are standing for election ?

data.chText: 参加竞选
data.enText: to run for election

data.chText: 当选
data.enText: the fact of having been chosen by election

data.chText: 我们欢迎他当选总统。
data.enText: We welcome his election as president.

data.chText: 她获选进入该委员会之后一年
data.enText: a year after her election to the committee

data.text: election ♦ vote ♦ poll ♦ referendum ♦ straw poll ♦ ballot ♦ show of hands

data.chText: 以上各词均表示选举或投票表决。
data.enText: These are all words for an event in which people choose a representative or decide sth by voting.
election

data.chText: 指选举、推选，尤指政治选举：
data.enText: an occasion on which people officially choose a political representative or government by voting

data.chText: 上次选举中你把票投给了谁？
data.enText: Who did you vote for in the last election?
vote

data.chText: 指投票、选举、表决：
data.enText: an occasion on which a group of people vote for sb/sth

data.chText: 他们以投票方式决定谁先走。
data.enText: They took a vote on who should go first.
poll

data.chText: （新闻）指选举投票、计票：
data.enText: ( journalism ) the process of voting in an election

data.chText: 他们在投票选举中惨遭失败。
data.enText: They suffered a defeat at the polls .
referendum

data.chText: 指全民投票、全民公决
data.enText: an occasion on which all the adults in a country can vote on a particular issue
straw poll

data.chText: 指非正式民意测验：
data.enText: an occasion on which a number of people are asked in an informal way to give their opinion about sth

data.chText: 我在同事中很快做了一个民意测验看有多少人赞同。
data.enText: I took a quick straw poll among my colleagues to see how many agreed.
ballot

data.chText: 尤指无记名投票选举、投票表决：
data.enText: the system of voting by marking an election paper, especially in secret; an occasion on which a vote is held

data.chText: 领导者将通过无记名投票选举产生。
data.enText: The leader will be chosen by secret ballot.

data.chText: ballot通常用于机构内部的选举，而非公众的投票选举。
data.enText: Ballot is usually used about a vote within an organization rather than an occasion on which the public vote.
show of hands

data.chText: 指举手表决
data.enText: an occasion on which a group of people vote on sth by raising their hands
a national/local/federal/democratic/free/fair election/vote/poll/referendum/ballot
a presidential/parliamentary/congressional/council election/poll
to conduct a(n) election/vote/poll/referendum/straw poll/ballot
to have a(n) election/vote/poll/referendum/straw poll/ballot/show of hands
to hold a(n) election/vote/poll/referendum/straw poll/ballot
take a vote/straw poll/show of hands
a(n) election/referendum campaign/result/victory/defeat

tr: the act of selecting someone or something
example: her election of medicine as a profession

tr: a vote to select the winner of a position or political office
example: the results of the election will be announced tonight

tr: the predestination of some individuals as objects of divine mercy (especially as conceived by Calvinists)
the status or fact of being elected

value.def: An election is a process in which people vote to choose a person or group of people to hold an official position.

example.ex: ...the first fully free elections for more than fifty years...
example.tran: 50多年来第一次完全自由的选举

example.ex: During his election campaign he promised to put the economy back on its feet...
example.tran: 在竞选活动中，他承诺恢复经济活力。

example.ex: The final election results will be announced on Friday...
example.tran: 星期五将公布最终选举结果。

example.ex: Many residents say they have little or no idea who's standing for election.
example.tran: 很多居民说他们几乎不知道谁在竞选。

value.def: The election of a particular person or group of people is their success in winning an election.

example.ex: ...the election of the Labour government in 1964.
The Democrat candidate is the favorite to win election.
example.tran: 民主党候选人最有希望赢得选举。

trans: 总统竞选；美国总统大选；美国总统选举；总统选举；总统大选
补缺选举；佩林可参加缺补选举；特选；特别选举；加州特别选举
提前选举；临时选举；仓促的选举
